body.p: To Genl Breckenridge I want everything found in my clothes. I have never have assumed a position in regard to our public difficulties ^which was not^ sustained by the judgement of the people. I wanted personal honor and political liberty and Constitutional State Government, and for these I drew the sword, and until those terms could be secured either ^by^ negotiation or on the dictated from the field of battle, of course we could have no other duty than to remain at our post

George W. Johnston
Provisional Governor of Ky
My wife knows how well I love her and she needs no message from to tell her how I love her
I wanted and my ^wife & children^ to make duty to God and man the rule of this conduct
